page.title: 04CHURCH-GOING IN FERNESS
page.content: Ferness lies within Ardclach Parish. It has no church of its own but the community was able to attend Ardclach Church across the River Findhorn, using a footbridge (which unfortunately was washed away in 1958). A church was first built on the river's bank in 1626, but has been replaced twice and renovated in 1892. It has no bell tower, but a bell was placed on an old watchtower/prison (which was built in 1655 and is now designated an ancient monument) high on a hill nearby. It was said that the noise of the river's torrent would have drowned out any bell ringing on the church itself. A second United Free church was built around 1844 but the congregations were united in 1933 and the old church has fallen into disuse. Ardclach is now merged with Auldearn.
